t: Mark 12

And*p he began to speak unto them by parables. A*r certain*r man*r planted*r a*r vineyard,*r and*r set*r an*r hedge*r about*r it,*r and*r digged*r a*r place*r for*r the*r winefat,*r and*r built*r a*r tower,*r and*r let*r it*r out*r to*r husbandmen,*r and*r went*r into*r a*r far*r country.*r
And*rp at*r the*r season*r he*r sent*r to*r the*r husbandmen*r a*r servant,*r that*r he*r might*r receive*r from*r the*r husbandmen*r of*r the*r fruit*r of*r the*r vineyard.*r
And*rp they*r caught*r him,*r and*r beat*r him,*r and*r sent*r him*r away*r empty.*r
And*rp again*r he*r sent*r unto*r them*r another*r servant;*r and*r at*r him*r they*r cast*r stones,*r and*r wounded*r him*r in*r the*r head,*r and*r sent*r him*r away*r shamefully*r handled.*r
And*rp again*r he*r sent*r another;*r and*r him*r they*r killed,*r and*r many*r others;*r beating*r some,*r and*r killing*r some.*r
Having*rp yet*r therefore*r one*r son,*r his*r wellbeloved,*r he*r sent*r him*r also*r last*r unto*r them,*r saying,*r They*r will*r reverence*r my*r son.*r
But*rp those*r husbandmen*r said*r among*r themselves,*r This*r is*r the*r heir;*r come,*r let*r us*r kill*r him,*r and*r the*r inheritance*r shall*r be*r ours.*r
And*rp they*r took*r him,*r and*r killed*r him,*r and*r cast*r him*r out*r of*r the*r vineyard.*r
What*rp shall*r therefore*r the*r lord*r of*r the*r vineyard*r do?*r he*r will*r come*r and*r destroy*r the*r husbandmen,*r and*r will*r give*r the*r vineyard*r unto*r others.*r
And*rp have*r ye*r not*r read*r this*r scripture;*r The*r stone*r which*r the*r builders*r rejected*r is*r become*r the*r head*r of*r the*r corner:*r
This*rp was*r the*r Lord's*r doing,*r and*r it*r is*r marvellous*r in*r our*r eyes?*r
And*p they sought to lay hold on him, but feared the people: for they knew that he had spoken the parable against them: and they left him, and went their way.
And*p they send unto him certain of the Pharisees and of the Herodians, to catch him in his words.

And*p when they were come, they say unto him, Master, we know that thou art true, and carest for no man: for thou regardest not the person of men, but teachest the way of God in truth: Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar, or not?
Shall*p we give, or shall we not give? But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said unto them, Why*r tempt*r ye*r me?*r bring*r me*r a*r penny,*r that*r I*r may*r see*r it.*r
And*p they brought it. And he saith unto them, Whose*r is*r this*r image*r and*r superscription?*r And they said unto him, Caesar's.
And*p Jesus answering said unto them, Render*r to*r Caesar*r the*r things*r that*r are*r Caesar's,*r and*r to*r God*r the*r things*r that*r are*r God's.*r And they marvelled at him.
Then*p come unto him the Sadducees, which say there is no resurrection; and they asked him, saying,
Master,*p Moses wrote unto us, If a man's brother die, and leave his wife behind him, and leave no children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.
Now*p there were seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and dying left no seed.
And*p the second took her, and died, neither left he any seed: and the third likewise.
And*p the seven had her, and left no seed: last of all the woman died also.
In*p the resurrection therefore, when they shall rise, whose wife shall she be of them? for the seven had her to wife.
And*p Jesus answering said unto them, Do*r ye*r not*r therefore*r err,*r because*r ye*r know*r not*r the*r scriptures,*r neither*r the*r power*r of*r God?*r
For*rp when*r they*r shall*r rise*r from*r the*r dead,*r they*r neither*r marry,*r nor*r are*r given*r in*r marriage;*r but*r are*r as*r the*r angels*r which*r are*r in*r heaven.*r

And*rp as*r touching*r the*r dead,*r that*r they*r rise:*r have*r ye*r not*r read*r in*r the*r book*r of*r Moses,*r how*r in*r the*r bush*r God*r spake*r unto*r him,*r saying,*r I*r am*r the*r God*r of*r Abraham,*r and*r the*r God*r of*r Isaac,*r and*r the*r God*r of*r Jacob?*r
He*rp is*r not*r the*r God*r of*r the*r dead,*r but*r the*r God*r of*r the*r living:*r ye*r therefore*r do*r greatly*r err.*r
And*p one of the scribes came, and having heard them reasoning together, and perceiving that he had answered them well, asked him, Which is the first commandment of all?
And*p Jesus answered him, The*r first*r of*r all*r the*r commandments*r is,*r Hear,*r O*r Israel;*r The*r Lord*r our*r God*r is*r one*r Lord:*r

And*rp thou*r shalt*r love*r the*r Lord*r thy*r God*r with*r all*r thy*r heart,*r and*r with*r all*r thy*r soul,*r and*r with*r all*r thy*r mind,*r and*r with*r all*r thy*r strength:*r this*r is*r the*r first*r commandment.*r
And*rp the*r second*r is*r like,*r namely*r this,*r Thou*r shalt*r love*r thy*r neighbour*r as*r thyself.*r There*r is*r none*r other*r commandment*r greater*r than*r these.*r
And*p the scribe said unto him, Well, Master, thou hast said the truth: for there is one God; and there is none other but he:

And*p to love him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, and with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love his neighbour as himself, is more than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.
And*p when Jesus saw that he answered discreetly, he said unto him, Thou*r art*r not*r far*r from*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r And no man after that durst ask him any question.
And*p Jesus answered and said, while he taught in the temple, How*r say*r the*r scribes*r that*r Christ*r is*r the*r Son*r of*r David?*r
For*rp David*r himself*r said*r by*r the*r Holy*r Ghost,*r The*r Lord*r said*r to*r my*r Lord,*r Sit*r thou*r on*r my*r right*r hand,*r till*r I*r make*r thine*r enemies*r thy*r footstool.*r
David*rp therefore*r himself*r calleth*r him*r Lord;*r and*r whence*r is*r he*r then*r his*r son?*r And the common people heard him gladly.
And*p he said unto them in his doctrine, Beware*r of*r the*r scribes,*r which*r love*r to*r go*r in*r long*r clothing,*r and*r love*r salutations*r in*r the*r marketplaces,*r
And*rp the*r chief*r seats*r in*r the*r synagogues,*r and*r the*r uppermost*r rooms*r at*r feasts:*r
Which*rp devour*r widows'*r houses,*r and*r for*r a*r pretence*r make*r long*r prayers:*r these*r shall*r receive*r greater*r damnation.*r
And*p Jesus sat over against the treasury, and beheld how the people cast money into the treasury: and many that were rich cast in much.
And*p there came a certain poor widow, and she threw in two mites, which make a farthing.

And*p he called unto him his disciples, and saith unto them, Verily*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r That*r this*r poor*r widow*r hath*r cast*r more*r in,*r than*r all*r they*r which*r have*r cast*r into*r the*r treasury:*r
For*rp all*r they*r did*r cast*r in*r of*r their*r abundance;*r but*r she*r of*r her*r want*r did*r cast*r in*r all*r that*r she*r had,*r even*r all*r her*r living.*r
